## Description {#details}

Helper class to build <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a>.

It keeps internally the insertion point and debug location for all the new instructions we want to create. This information can be modified via the related setters.

Definition at line 235 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h">MachineIRBuilder.h</a>.

### buildAnyExt() {#acac15566596b1d588d87450ab77bf0d7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder MachineIRBuilder::buildAnyExt (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Op)</>}>
Build and insert <code>Res</code> = G&#95;ANYEXT <code>Op0</code>.

G&#95;ANYEXT produces a register of the specified width, with bits 0 to sizeof(<code>Ty</code>) &#42; 8 set to <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code>. The remaining bits are unspecified (i.e. this is neither zero nor sign-extension). For a vector register, each element is extended individually.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Res</code> must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code> must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code> must be smaller than <code>Res</code>
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
The newly created instruction.
</SectionUser>

<CodeBlock>
  Atomically replace the value at \\p Addr with \\p NewVal if it is currently
  \\p CmpVal otherwise leaves it unchanged. Puts the original value from \\p
  Addr in \\p Res, along with an s1 indicating whether it was replaced.

  \\pre setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
  \\pre \\p OldValRes must be a generic virtual register of scalar type.
  \\pre \\p SuccessRes must be a generic virtual register of scalar type. It
       will be assigned 0 on failure and 1 on success.
  \\pre \\p Addr must be a generic virtual register with pointer type.
  \\pre \\p OldValRes, \\p CmpVal, and \\p NewVal must be generic virtual
       registers of the same type.

  \\return a MachineInstrBuilder for the newly created instruction. 
</CodeBlock>

### buildAtomicRMWUSubCond() {#a4b09525023b6ebfc6954493271dded49}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder llvm::MachineIRBuilder::buildAtomicRMWUSubCond (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; OldValRes, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Addr, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Val, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinememoperand">MachineMemOperand</a> &amp; MMO)</>}>
Build and insert <code>OldValRes&lt;def&gt; = G&#95;ATOMICRMW&#95;USUB&#95;COND Addr, Val, MMO</code>.

Atomically replace the value at <code>Addr</code> with the original value minus <code>Val</code> if the original value is greater than or equal to <code>Val</code>, or leaves it unchanged otherwise. Puts the original value from <code>Addr</code> in <code>OldValRes</code>.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>OldValRes</code> must be a generic virtual register.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Addr</code> must be a generic virtual register with pointer type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>OldValRes</code>, and <code>Val</code> must be generic virtual registers of the same type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">

### buildBuildVectorTrunc() {#a7acf8a5ebb4b351a451a2d63faf13294}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder MachineIRBuilder::buildBuildVectorTrunc (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; Ops)</>}>
Build and insert <code>Res</code> = G&#95;BUILD&#95;VECTOR&#95;TRUNC <code>Op0</code>, ...

G&#95;BUILD&#95;VECTOR&#95;TRUNC creates a vector value from multiple scalar registers which have types larger than the destination vector element type, and truncates the values to fit.

If the operands given are already the same size as the vector elt type, then this method will instead create a G&#95;BUILD&#95;VECTOR instruction.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
The type of all <code>Ops</code> registers must be identical.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstrbuilder">MachineInstrBuilder</a> for the newly created instruction.
</SectionUser>

### buildIntrinsic() {#a4b8abd0c10d11d7388c85825c9c220bf}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder MachineIRBuilder::buildIntrinsic (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/intrinsic/#a80add6b3b1cdaec560907995127adc16">Intrinsic::ID</a> ID, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; Res, bool HasSideEffects, bool isConvergent)</>}>
Build and insert a G&#95;INTRINSIC instruction.

There are four different opcodes based on combinations of whether the intrinsic has side effects and whether it is convergent. These properties can be specified as explicit parameters, or else they are retrieved from the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mcid">MCID</a> for the intrinsic.

The parameter <code>Res</code> provides the Registers or MOs that will be defined by this instruction.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstrbuilder">MachineInstrBuilder</a> for the newly created instruction.
</SectionUser>

### buildMaskLowPtrBits() {#af6aed1d3b2cf7133b73cf8bfa5122186}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder MachineIRBuilder::buildMaskLowPtrBits (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Op0, uint32&#95;t NumBits)</>}>
Build and insert <code>Res</code> = G&#95;PTRMASK <code>Op0</code>, <code>G&#95;CONSTANT</code> (1 &lt;&lt; NumBits) - 1.

This clears the low bits of a pointer operand without destroying its pointer properties. This has the effect of rounding the address <em>down</em> to a specified alignment in bits.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Res</code> and <code>Op0</code> must be generic virtual registers with pointer type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>NumBits</code> must be an integer representing the number of low bits to be cleared in <code>Op0</code>.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">

### buildMergeLikeInstr() {#a7075ef788cb3dea0ea239c1a6830734c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder MachineIRBuilder::buildMergeLikeInstr (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &gt; Ops)</>}>
Build and insert <code>Res</code> = G&#95;MERGE&#95;VALUES <code>Op0</code>, ... or <code>Res</code> = G&#95;BUILD&#95;VECTOR <code>Op0</code>, ... or <code>Res</code> = G&#95;CONCAT&#95;VECTORS <code>Op0</code>, ...

G&#95;MERGE&#95;VALUES combines the input elements contiguously into a larger register. It is used when the destination register is not a vector. G&#95;BUILD&#95;VECTOR combines scalar inputs into a vector register. G&#95;CONCAT&#95;VECTORS combines vector inputs into a vector register.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
The entire register <code>Res</code> (and no more) must be covered by the input registers.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
The type of all <code>Ops</code> registers must be identical.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstrbuilder">MachineInstrBuilder</a> for the newly created instruction. The opcode of the new instruction will depend on the types of both the destination and the sources.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h/#l01055">1055</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h">MachineIRBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-cpp/#l00656">656</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-cpp">MachineIRBuilder.cpp</a>.

G&#95;PTR&#95;ADD adds <code>Op1</code> addressible units to the pointer specified by <code>Op0</code>, storing the resulting pointer in <code>Res</code>. Addressible units are typically bytes but this can vary between targets.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Res</code> and <code>Op0</code> must be generic virtual registers with pointer type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Op1</code> must be a generic virtual register with scalar type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstrbuilder">MachineInstrBuilder</a> for the newly created instruction.
</SectionUser>

### buildSExt() {#a42427e969917da5da61fadd006fed326}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder MachineIRBuilder::buildSExt (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Op)</>}>
Build and insert <code>Res</code> = G&#95;SEXT <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code>.

G&#95;SEXT produces a register of the specified width, with bits 0 to sizeof(<code>Ty</code>) &#42; 8 set to <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code>. The remaining bits are duplicated from the high bit of <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code> (i.e. 2s-complement sign extended).


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Res</code> must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code> must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code> must be smaller than <code>Res</code>
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
The newly created instruction.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h/#l00699">699</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h">MachineIRBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-cpp/#l00500">500</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-cpp">MachineIRBuilder.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### buildTrunc() {#abf1763199cd36c9253c6f062fa5e973e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder MachineIRBuilder::buildTrunc (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Op, std::optional&lt; unsigned &gt; Flags=std::nullopt)</>}>
Build and insert <code>Res</code> = G&#95;TRUNC <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code>.

G&#95;TRUNC extracts the low bits of a type. For a vector type each element is truncated independently before being packed into the destination.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>

### buildUAdde() {#abfcd8132aaf36162d0ac865c74933456}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder llvm::MachineIRBuilder::buildUAdde (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; CarryOut, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Op0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Op1, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; CarryIn)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Build and insert <code>Res</code>, <code>CarryOut</code> = G&#95;UADDE <code>Op0</code>, <code>Op1</code>, <code>CarryIn</code>.

G&#95;UADDE sets <code>Res</code> to <code>Op0</code> + <code>Op1</code> + <code>CarryIn</code> (truncated to the bit width) and sets <code>CarryOut</code> to 1 if the result overflowed in unsigned arithmetic.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Res</code>, <code>Op0</code> and <code>Op1</code> must be generic virtual registers with the same scalar type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>CarryOut</code> and <code>CarryIn</code> must be generic virtual registers with the same scalar type (typically s1)
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
The newly created instruction.
</SectionUser>

### buildZExt() {#a44a49b5f4dd2932058e3fbe21c098655}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstrBuilder MachineIRBuilder::buildZExt (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dstop">DstOp</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/srcop">SrcOp</a> &amp; Op, std::optional&lt; unsigned &gt; Flags=std::nullopt)</>}>
Build and insert <code>Res</code> = G&#95;ZEXT <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code>.

G&#95;ZEXT produces a register of the specified width, with bits 0 to sizeof(<code>Ty</code>) &#42; 8 set to <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code>. The remaining bits are 0. For a vector register, each element is extended individually.


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Res</code> must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code> must be a generic virtual register with scalar or vector type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a></code> must be smaller than <code>Res</code>
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
The newly created instruction.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h/#l00760">760</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h">MachineIRBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-cpp/#l00505">505</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-cpp">MachineIRBuilder.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### materializePtrAdd() {#a0f2bb4d63ad6914f3783967bf881a14b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; MachineInstrBuilder &gt; MachineIRBuilder::materializePtrAdd (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> &amp; Res, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> Op0, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/llt">LLT</a> ValueTy, uint64&#95;t Value)</>}>
Materialize and insert <code>Res</code> = G&#95;PTR&#95;ADD <code>Op0</code>, (G&#95;CONSTANT <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code>)

G&#95;PTR&#95;ADD adds <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code> bytes to the pointer specified by <code>Op0</code>, storing the resulting pointer in <code>Res</code>. If <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code> is zero then no G&#95;PTR&#95;ADD or G&#95;CONSTANT will be created and 
<SectionUser title="Precondition">
Op0 will be assigned to <code>Res</code>.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
setBasicBlock or setMI must have been called.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Op0</code> must be a generic virtual register with pointer type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>ValueTy</code> must be a scalar type.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Precondition">
<code>Res</code> must be 0. This is to detect confusion between <a href="#a0f2bb4d63ad6914f3783967bf881a14b">materializePtrAdd()</a> and <a href="#a7aae2634e3c0980c4f68983738b90ff7">buildPtrAdd()</a>.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Postcondition">
<code>Res</code> will either be a new generic virtual register of the same type as <code>Op0</code> or <code>Op0</code> itself.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstrbuilder">MachineInstrBuilder</a> for the newly created instruction.
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h/#l00536">536</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/include/llvm/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-h">MachineIRBuilder.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-cpp/#l00212">212</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/machineirbuilder-cpp">MachineIRBuilder.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
